DOC.brief_summary: Graft-versus-host-disease (GVHD) is a major obstacle to successful allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation (alloHCT). Cannabidiol (CBD), a non-psychotropic ingredient of Cannabis sativa possesses potent anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive properties. In a recent phase 2 study, CBD has been shown to be safe and reduced significantly the incidence of acute GVHD compared to control patients with a hazard ratio of 0.3. Based on these results the investigators propose a phase 2 study to explore the efficacy of oral CBD in the treatment of severe (grades III/IV) acute GVHD, a pathology with a dismal prognosis.
DOC.brief_title: Cannabidiol for the Treatment of Severe (Grades III/IV) Acute Graft-versus-host Disease
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients 18 years or older 2. After allogeneic transplantation 3. Grade III or IV acute GVHD 4. No psychiatric contraindication 5. Informed consent 1. History of psychosis 2. Asthma 3. Known allergy to cannabis constituents
